lines.text: When you call me madam, smile.
You are the most American American I have ever met.
That's the nicest thing anyone's ever said to me.
When will you arrive at your post?
I'm not sure. Hey, boss, where the heck is Lichtenburg?
Sally, you wouldn't like me to make a little farewell speech tonight?
Tell me - How does this reception differ from your famous Washington parties?
Well we have a good time!
And if I may be permitted an extremely unofficial remark, off the record, as you say, the American ambassador is very beautiful.
A good optometrist could clean up around here.
And just to make sure I haven't got a chance, they make me wear this.
I don't mind a "train," but they shouldn't have given me the Super Chief!
